page.description: Summarize the records of the table into a specified output table.
page.syntax: V Summarize(), Specify the required values in the Sum dot variable, then use the following command: <TBL>.SUMMARIZE()

item.name: sum.db
item.description: Type "C". The name of the resulting table.

item.name: sum.order
item.description: Type "C". A character order expression that sorts selected records.

item.name: sum.filter
item.description: Type "C". A character filter expression that selects records to process.

item.name: sum.options
item.description: Type "C". Options used when ordering the Result table records. This string can contain one or more of the following index codes:

item.name: D
item.description: The Descending Order option puts the records in the Result table in descending alphabetical order or, for a numeric field, from highest to lowest value.

item.name: U
item.description: The Unique option uses only unique records in the summary.

item.name: sum.fields
item.description: Type "N". Indicates how many fields are to be summarized. Each field to be included in the Summary operation is declared through a pair of parameters that indicate the field name and summary operator for that field.

item.name: sum.field1 ... C sum.fieldN
item.description: Type "C". Fields (1 ... N) containing the names of the field(s) to be summarized.

item.name: sum.code1 ... N sum.codeN
item.description: Type "N". Fields (1 ... N) containing the operation codes for the fields to be summarized. The following codes may be used:

item.name: SUM_OP_TOTAL (1)
item.description: Operation: Total. Returns: The sum of values for the specified field or expression.

item.name: SUM_OP_COUNT (2)
item.description: Operation: Count. Returns: A count of the number of records included in the specified field or expression.

item.name: SUM_OP_MIN (3)
item.description: Operation: Min. Returns: The minimum (smallest) value for the specified field or expression.

item.name: SUM_OP_MAX (4)
item.description: Operation: Max. Returns: The maximum (largest) value for the specified field or expression.

item.name: SUM_OP_AVERAGE (5)
item.description: Operation: Average. Returns: The average of values for the specified field or expression. .

item.name: SUM_OP_FIRST (6)
item.description: Operation: First. Returns: The first value for the specified field or expression.

item.name: SUM_OP_LAST (7)
item.description: Operation: Last. Returns: The last value for the specified field or expression.

item.name: NULL (15)
item.description: Returns: Adds a column label in the output table for the specified field.

section.title: Discussion
section.discussion: The <TBL>.SUMMARIZE() method is a high-level utility used to summarize the records of a specified table, creating a new table to store the result. Most parameters passed to <TBL>.SUMMARIZE()through the summary function variable correspond directly with the prompts appearing on the Summarize Builder which is accessed by defining a new summary operation from the Control Panel.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script counts the number of customers who live in each state. The result will be put in the specified output table.
section.example: output_tbl = ui_get_file("Result Table","Tables(*.DBF)","","N") if output_tbl = "" then end end if tbl = table.current() sum.db = output_tbl sum.order = "STATE_PROV" sum.filter = "" sum.options = "I" sum.fields = 2 sum.field1 = "STATE_PROV" sum.code1 = 0 sum.field2 = "LAST_NAME" sum.code2 = 2 tbl.summarize()
